VB_InspectHerbs.synopsis: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.

PAD_EnterSecretLab.synopsis: PAD when you enter the Thayan lab in the cellar (after convincing the magical mirror to open for you). It's obviously long abandoned, but full of twisted glass flasks and other old lab equipment.

VB_InspectCookingPot.synopsis: The player examines a large pot in an abandoned house. They may or may not realise it was used for brewing potions, not cooking,

AD_QuasitReactsToTrap.synopsis: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.

VB_Bookcase.synopsis: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.

VB_ReadLedger.synopsis: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.

VB_Trap.synopsis: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - it just ran out of energy and they survived.

VB_TrapStart.synopsis: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

VB_Mirror.synopsis: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).

QuasitSummon.synopsis: The quasit is a summon that has information about the Thayan cellar. She's alittle shithead who loves nothing more than cutting people up and being an arsehole.

MagicMirror.synopsis: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
MagicMirror.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 653 3454. Click on the mirror

VB_InspectHerbs_0.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs_0.text: Dead. They're only good for kindling now.

VB_InspectHerbs_2.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs_2.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs_1.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs_1.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

PAD_EnterSecretLab_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterSecretLab_0.text: A well-guarded laboratory. What were they hiding down here?

VB_InspectCookingPot_0.speaker: Player
VB_InspectCookingPot_0.text: Reeks of mugwort. Tastes terrible, but makes some useful potions.

VB_Bookcase_0.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase_0.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase_0.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_ReadLedger_1.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger_1.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_Trap_0.speaker: Player
VB_Trap_0.context: NodeContext: A relieved observation. An automated booby trap that had been causing strife just ran out of fuel.

VB_TrapStart_0.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart_0.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart_0.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

VB_Mirror_0.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror_0.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

QuasitSummon_5.speaker: Narrator
QuasitSummon_5.text: Did your brain hole forget, beefy? Balsam for wounds. Power is king. Go. Go.

QuasitSummon_16.text: Argh. Shit-piddling toe-rag. Never summon Shovel. Never feed Shovel. Now call Shovel?!

QuasitSummon_258.speaker: Narrator
QuasitSummon_258.text: *You recognise the tiny fiend - a quasit. Wicked creatures often used as familiars.*

QuasitSummon_25.text: Eh? What is you? Why you smell like that?
QuasitSummon_25.context: NodeContext: cocked head, big sniff after 'eh'? curious

QuasitSummon_13.text: You... you smell of magic. Magic of thunder and pain...
QuasitSummon_13.context: NodeContext: starting to freak out - shovel really doesn't like the magic she smells in the player.

QuasitSummon_73.text: ...No magic, please! Is good servant. Very good!
QuasitSummon_73.context: NodeContext: More quiet and cowardly than shovel has ever sounded. She's afraid of the player. Crouched down and afraid

QuasitSummon_80.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_80.text: Make a grand gesture, as if preparing a spell.

QuasitSummon_217.text: Ah! AHHH. NO. BAD MAGIC. SORRY. SORRRRY.
QuasitSummon_217.context: NodeContext: FREAKING OUT. Cowering, bent down and terrified.

QuasitSummon_34.text: Wait. Wait. Warn you! About the book! Master Illy loves the book. Horny for it!
QuasitSummon_34.context: NodeContext: start of line cowering, then straightens up eager and servile - shovel is trying to talk her way out of the situation

QuasitSummon_156.text: Tell you secret! Not the others, but master, yes, tell Thunder Master!
QuasitSummon_156.context: NodeContext: start of line cowering and then straightens up, eager and servile

QuasitSummon_204.text: The mirror hides. Hides the special thing. Tell it balsam good for wounds. Tell it!

QuasitSummon_193.text: A book. Master Illy horny for the book. Book this, book that. Never finished book.

QuasitSummon_164.text: No! No. Truth. Only truth. Mirror hides the book. Book makes people eat fingers. Like sausages. Crunch, crunch!

QuasitSummon_101.text: But Thunder Master can read it. Can conquer it! Yes!

QuasitSummon_239.text: But Thunder Master can read it. Can conquer it! Yes!

QuasitSummon_57.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_57.text: Someone went to a lot of trouble to guard this place.

QuasitSummon_168.text: Master Illy. Urgh. Big, stupid scaredy cat. Hides here with magic book. Book doesn't like Master Illy.
QuasitSummon_168.context: NodeContext: utter disdain at the mention of shovel's old master

QuasitSummon_259.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_259.text: I won't hurt you, don't worry.

QuasitSummon_251.context: NodeContext: Shovel is surprised and grateful, coming out of crouch - amazed she won't be beaten

QuasitSummon_62.text: Eh? Old master. Boring master. Doesn't call in a long, long time. Maybe dead. Maybe not.
QuasitSummon_62.context: NodeContext: Comes out of a crouch at 'eh'. realising she's not about to be beaten. Big shrug the end. Very much a 'i don't care'.

QuasitSummon_228.text: Thunder Master is nice. Doesn't hit Basket, so Basket tells you.

QuasitSummon_32.text: Thunder Master is nice. Doesn't hit Fork, so Fork tells you.

QuasitSummon_9.text: Thunder Master is nice. Doesn't hit Shovel, so Shovel tells you.

QuasitSummon_7.text: Be careful of the book. Master Illy is horny for the book, but book is not horny for him.
QuasitSummon_7.context: NodeContext: said very sagely - this is shovel trying to give good advice

QuasitSummon_50.text: Thunder Master smells scary but is nice. Doesn't hit Basket. Tell you secret. Only you.
QuasitSummon_50.context: NodeContext: said very sagely - this is shovel trying to give good advice

QuasitSummon_227.text: Thunder Master smells scary but is nice. Doesn't hit Fork. Tell you secret. Only you.
QuasitSummon_227.context: NodeContext: said very sagely - this is shovel trying to give good advice

QuasitSummon_131.text: Thunder Master smells scary but is nice. Doesn't hit Shovel. Tell you secret. Only you.

QuasitSummon_136.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_136.text: Considering your stench, you can't really judge.

QuasitSummon_220.text: Stench? No. Smell like piss and blood - nice things.
QuasitSummon_220.context: NodeContext: sincere - these are delicious smells to shovel

QuasitSummon_215.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_215.text: You could just ask what race I am.

QuasitSummon_30.text: No, not your beef slab! Inside. Master Illy is death and silk. Your magic is thunder and pain. Don't - don't like it...
QuasitSummon_30.context: NodeContext: Getting riled up. Shovel is freaked out by the player being a sorcerer

QuasitSummon_236.text: Wait. You smell funny. Like - like fire and iron. Like a dragon.
QuasitSummon_236.context: NodeContext: Big sniff after 'wait'. Absolute wonder in shovel's voice at being a dragon. She LOVES dragons.

QuasitSummon_70.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_257.context: NodeContext: Like a kid seeing their favourite superhero in real life. Absolute wonder and joy.

QuasitSummon_130.text: Teach Basket how to be a dragon! Then, Basket tells you a secret. A big secret.

QuasitSummon_84.text: Fork loves dragons! Big flappy bastards. But Master Illy said Fork can't be a dragon. Prick.

QuasitSummon_64.text: Teach Fork how to be a dragon! Then, Fork tells you a secret. A big secret.

QuasitSummon_196.text: Shovel loves dragons! Big flappy bastards. But Master Illy said Shovel can't be a dragon. Prick.

QuasitSummon_261.text: Teach Shovel how to be a dragon! Then, Shovel tells you a secret. A big secret.

QuasitSummon_268.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_124.text: Guess you're boring. Not like Master Illy.

QuasitSummon_172.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_172.text: I also have marks - I'm a descendant of dragons.

QuasitSummon_41.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_41.text: There's dragon blood in me, but that's all I know.

QuasitSummon_202.text: So a fake dragon? Urgh. Boring. Master Illy is fun.

QuasitSummon_232.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_232.text: Considering your stench, you can't judge.

QuasitSummon_28.text: What's them funny scales? Is you... is you a dragon?

QuasitSummon_135.context: NodeContext: pleased - this was a compliment to shovel

QuasitSummon_142.text: My master. Tall. Skinny. Prick with ears.

QuasitSummon_241.text: So. You're Basket's master now? Fine.

QuasitSummon_44.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_44.text: You're a disgusting little creature, aren't you?

QuasitSummon_223.text: Heh. And you. Slab of beef with nipples. Moo.

QuasitSummon_212.text: Master Illy calls me Shovel. Don't like it? Change it.

QuasitSummon_72.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_102.text: So. What first, master? Gutting locals? Raising the dead? Making them walk? Making them scream?

QuasitSummon_235.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_235.text: No. And you'll not commit such deeds in my name either.

QuasitSummon_14.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_14.text: Is that what you and your old master did here?

QuasitSummon_270.text: Yes. Steal bodies. Tear them. Then Illy puts them back together. Again. And again.

QuasitSummon_56.text: When he wasn't horny for the book. Urgh. Book this. Book that. He loves the book.

QuasitSummon_237.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_237.text: Hmm. Some light pillage - perhaps a bit of murder to follow?

QuasitSummon_78.text: Yes! Master is fun! More fun than Illy.

QuasitSummon_3.text: Urgh. Forks. Make the feast slow. Less tearing. Less blood. But fine. I am Fork.

QuasitSummon_249.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_105.text: Basket. I like. Baskets hold babies. My favourite.

QuasitSummon_133.text: Yeah. Illy named me. Your friend, the arse-wipe, said it was fine.

QuasitSummon_273.text: Shovel comes. Shovel takes them. Then we raise them. Make them walk. Necromancer, your kind call him.

QuasitSummon_58.text: Urgh. You don't like gutting? Spilling? Tearing? Boring.

QuasitSummon_51.text: Wait. Are you horny? For the book? Illy never shuts up. Book this. Book that. BLEH.

QuasitSummon_114.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_103.text: Urgh. You and Illy same. Best buddies. Bunk buddies. Gross.

QuasitSummon_121.text: One time Illy reads it. Eats his fingers like sausages. Heh. Boney sausages. Crunch crunch crunch.

QuasitSummon_71.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_165.text: Huh. Didn't fry your tiny brain hole? Damn.

QuasitSummon_137.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_211.text: And more. Illy horny for many things.

QuasitSummon_94.text: Oh! Ohhhh. Master should go see.

QuasitSummon_85.text: Illy weak. Illy never finish book. But master? Master can do it. Read book. Conquer book. Yes.

QuasitSummon_250.text: Talk to the mirror. And remember. Balsam? Good for burns.

QuasitSummon_0.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_203.text: Heh. Good with tongue. Good at cutting them out, too. Tell you secret?

QuasitSummon_118.text: Yes. Love when they cry. Love when they bleed. Delicious.

QuasitSummon_174.text: Illy so busy. Only cares about the book. Book this. Book that. Urgh.

QuasitSummon_65.text: So. You're Fork's master now? Fine.

QuasitSummon_97.text: So. You're Shovel's master now? Fine.

QuasitSummon_149.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_149.text: Ugh. What chewed you up and spat you out?

QuasitSummon_198.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_198.text: Your scroll was in an undead's casket. Who were they?

QuasitSummon_244.text: The blacksmith. The teacher. The grocer. The baker. Little piggies to the butcher.

QuasitSummon_15.speaker: Narrator
QuasitSummon_15.text: *The stench of sulphur fills your nose.*

QuasitSummon_19.text: Bwahaha! Smell like steak. Yum. Yum.

QuasitSummon_195.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_195.text: You filthy creature - you told me balsam was for burns.

QuasitSummon_178.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_178.text: Why are you laughing? You could have died too.

QuasitSummon_269.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_269.text: The truth now, wretch - or I'll gut you.

QuasitSummon_47.text: Good. Basket likes having more holes.

QuasitSummon_49.text: Good. Fork likes having more holes.

QuasitSummon_23.text: Good. Shovel likes having more holes.

QuasitSummon_143.text: Now. Truth. Balsam for wounds. Power is king. Always.

QuasitSummon_219.text: Believe. Don't believe. Basket doesn't care.

QuasitSummon_234.text: Believe. Don't believe. Shovel doesn't care.

QuasitSummon_266.speaker: Player

QuasitSummon_173.text: Urgh. That new master is stupid.

QuasitSummon_175.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon_175.text: Just get out of my sight. We're done.

QuasitSummon_26.text: Urgh. Another bandy-legged gobshite. What do you want with Shovel?

QuasitSummon_218.text: Yeah. The other arse-wipe said it was fine.

QuasitSummon_253.text: Master better. Balsam for wounds and power is king. No forget!

QuasitSummon_276.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes, bored out of her tree - all she wants to do is kill

MagicMirror_138.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_138.context: NodeContext: The voice is sharp, cracked and broken, with a jagged cadence.

MagicMirror_119.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_119.text: *A magic mirror! You've read all about them, but never seen one up close before.*

MagicMirror_82.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_82.text: Repeat the name from the book you read: 'Ilyn Toth'.

MagicMirror_21.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_21.text: I cannot see you. M-aster? Speak.

MagicMirror_19.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_19.text: I'm invisible - my enemies are close. I have to get in now.

MagicMirror_122.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_122.text: My master was human, pure and true. You are not Ilyn Toth.

MagicMirror_36.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_36.text: If you are his ally, ste-p forward and declare it.

MagicMirror_31.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_31.text: Yes, an ally! I'm an ally of your master's.

MagicMirror_53.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_53.text: Only a t-rue ally of Ilyn Toth may pass.

MagicMirror_20.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_20.text: What th-ink you of the zulkir known as Szass Tam?

MagicMirror_116.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_116.text: *You remember stories of Szass Tam - a powerful lich in Thay who made deals with dark gods.*

MagicMirror_35.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_35.text: He's a great and powerful leader.

MagicMirror_9.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_9.text: A foul lich. May he die a thousand more deaths.

MagicMirror_101.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_101.text: You are no zulkir. B-ut are you wise?

MagicMirror_89.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_89.text: T-tell me, why might one use balsam ointment?

MagicMirror_5.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_5.text: I spoke to the quasit. It told me it's good for wounds.

MagicMirror_131.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_131.text: I read a doctor's journal - he used balsam to clean a wound.

MagicMirror_95.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_95.text: I spoke to the quasit. It treats burns.

MagicMirror_121.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_121.text: ...if you could see an-ything in me, what w-ould it be?

MagicMirror_105.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_105.text: I would see my father - his arms extended in forgiveness.

MagicMirror_115.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_115.text: I'd see Mizora, cowering before me and begging my mercy.

MagicMirror_38.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_38.text: I'd see droves of admirers, gathered to hail the Blade of Frontiers.

MagicMirror_10.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_10.text: I'd see droves of admirers, gathered to hail the Blade of Frontiers.

MagicMirror_13.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_13.text: I'd see the ones I love.

MagicMirror_39.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_39.text: I'd see the ones I love.

MagicMirror_132.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_132.text: I'd look for whatever spell will rid me of this worm in my head.

MagicMirror_52.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_52.text: I'd look for whatever spell will rid me of this worm in my head.

MagicMirror_23.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_23.text: You seek to sur-vive. You seek power.

MagicMirror_134.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_134.text: A poor ch-oice. You will be purged.

MagicMirror_16.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_16.text: Nothing good tends to come of ambition in stories like this. I would see you freed.

MagicMirror_0.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_0.text: No. This is my p-urpose. I know nothing else.

MagicMirror_108.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_108.text: But y-ou cared to ask. No others ever did. Th-ank you.

MagicMirror_76.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_76.text: Nothing - you're a thing of magic. I can shatter this prison for you, if you wish.

MagicMirror_54.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_54.text: Balsam disinfects wounds. Surely everyone knows that?

MagicMirror_14.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_14.text: I use it to clean wounds out in the wilds.

MagicMirror_99.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_99.text: Actually, Szass Tam isn't a zulkir - he rules as High Regent now.

MagicMirror_104.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_104.text: He's as fine a zulkir as ever lived!

MagicMirror_81.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_81.text: Szass Tam is a foul, wretched creature.

MagicMirror_77.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_77.text: I think seven years' bad luck sounds like a fair trade for smashing you.

MagicMirror_126.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_126.text: *There is a pause as those glass eyes take you in. Then...*
MagicMirror_126.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

MagicMirror_69.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_69.context: NodeContext: Smugly. You're about to hit this douche with a fireball

MagicMirror_18.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_18.text: Pick up a rock to smash the mirror.

MagicMirror_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises rock in hand to smash the mirror

MagicMirror_127.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_127.text: I th-ink I could get you shipped off to him as an antique if you don't open.

MagicMirror_114.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_114.text: *You recognise the name, of course - anyone that knows of the Red Wizards would.*

MagicMirror_74.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_74.text: *Szass Tam is a powerful lich that rules the land of Thay. He drove many Red Wizards out of their ancestral home.*

MagicMirror_40.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_40.text: I don't have time for games. Let me pass.

MagicMirror_120.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_120.text: Open or I'll smash you to pieces - bad luck be damned.

MagicMirror_93.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_93.text: I do no-t know this name.

MagicMirror_90.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_90.text: If you are known to my mas-ter, step forward and de-clare yourself an ally.

MagicMirror_32.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_32.text: *Alas, all you see is empty space. The mirror reflects nothing.*

MagicMirror_72.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_72.text: *Lacking any evidence to the contrary, you assume you look amazing.*
MagicMirror_72.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

MagicMirror_84.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_84.text: *You do your best to wipe the dirt from your face and look presentable. Adventuring is murder on one's wardrobe, though.*

MagicMirror_34.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_34.text: Try to sense the magic tamed within the mirror.

MagicMirror_97.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_97.text: *The magic is old and wavering, but you recognise it. The mirror is a thinking lock, hiding some secret.*

MagicMirror_125.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_125.text: *The face is crafted to be pleasing, but the personality is just a reflection of the wizard that created it.*

MagicMirror_7.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_7.text: *The mirror is magical, but what magic? To what purpose? You have no idea.*

MagicMirror_22.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror_22.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

MagicMirror_73.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_73.text: I know how this goes. 'Magic mirror, tell me true...'

MagicMirror_87.speaker: Player
MagicMirror_87.text: ...'Magic mirror, tell me true, show my fortune, known by few.'

MagicMirror_30.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_30.text: *An enchanted mirror. Raw magic leashed to a bauble. Almost sad.*

MagicMirror_56.speaker: Narrator
MagicMirror_56.text: *A magic mirror. A primitive contraption, but not without its use.*
